definition: excelling both in morals and studies (idiom); top marks for studies and for behavior (at school)/a paragon of virtue and learning
article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)
double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time

sentences.english: Su Rose is a good student living with her mother for many years after the death of her father.
sentences.chinese: 苏玫瑰是个品学兼优的女生，和母亲一起相依为命。

sentences.english: In them most is the psychologically healthy positive upward, the excellent in conduct and academy student.
sentences.chinese: 他们中的多数是心理健康积极向上，品学兼优的学生。

sentences.english: He was a very bright student at school and excelled in most of his subjects.
sentences.chinese: 在学校里他品学兼优，深受老师和同学的喜爱。

sentences.english: The competition was extremely fierce and only the students with exceptional academic performance and personal qualities could be selected.
sentences.chinese: 名额竞争激烈，学校选送的都是品学兼优的学生。

sentences.english: Jing Ouyang is a good student with a good academic performance.
sentences.chinese: 欧阳靖同学是个品学兼优的好学生。

definition: conduct and learning (of an individual)/moral nature and skill
to pass a university entrance exam
to pass entrance exam/to enter college after a competitive exam
